text: William Daniel Leahy ( ; 6 May 1875 â€“ 20 July 1959) was an American naval officer. He was the most senior United States military officer on active duty during World War II. He was the Chief of Staff to the Commander in Chief from 1942 to 1949. Leahy died at the U.S. Naval Hospital in Bethesda, Maryland, on 20 July 1959, at the age of 84. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1875 births Category:1959 deaths Category:Governors of Puerto Rico Category:Chairmen of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Category:Ambassadors of the United States to France Category:American military personnel of the Spanish- American War Category:American military personnel of World War I Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Military people from Iowa
title: William D. Leahy
